Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of the strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mommyof2gurlz
Reviews.Content: Right off of the strip in the heart of Branson! Great value, and rooms were decent-ESP if all you are doing is sleeping! Love the deck off the rooms (community deck) great place to unwind from the day and have a beer!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rmr3599
Reviews.Content: We had a decent stay at this Motel. It's an older Motel but seemed to be a fairly well kept set of units. I see some have had problems with some of the rooms but we did not experience any of the same problems. Our room was clean, comfortable and was accessed easily. The staff when we visited was very friendly. My only drawback to this property for me was that it is on a hill and if you have mobility problems make sure you request a ground level room as another room may require climbing and walking. All in all a decent place to stay at a decent value when we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: ISeekSunshine
Reviews.Content: Key entry, no hair dryer or iron. Room rate was cheap and the room was clean gives the age.

Reviews.Title: “Bobby, Netta & pomeranians ( Bear, Bre & Prissy)”
Reviews.Author: Bobby A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Branson and were looking for a motel with curb appeal for a couple from the country, a Texan & an Okie. At first sight of Melody Lane, we knew it was our type of motel. Country look and quiet with slight hint of upscale accommodations.The clerk and Manager were very polite and considerate. We had our three Pomeranians with us, and it it usually hard to find a room. We were offered a room that allowed pets. A small fee of $10 per pet that I was happy to pay. Upon entering the room we noticed how clean and well organized it was. Everything was there and had to request nothing from the desk. We had a very pleasant stay and will on stay at Melody Lane when we return to Branson in the spring. I would like to congratulate the staff and management of Melody Lane for the cleanliness, organization, welcoming atmosphere that we felt upon arriving and during our stay. Let me not forget about the wonderful continental breakfast that we had the morning after our stay, it was self serve and plenty of everything, mmmmmmm good.

Reviews.Title: “anniversary nightmare”
Reviews.Author: george w
Reviews.Content: Checked in that afternoon, went to the room, put our belongings down, grabed a bite to eat, went out on the strip, went to a show & dinner, came back to our room for the night and then it happened! As we were sitting on the bed watching tv and talking, my wife saw Roaches running around on the night stand and coming out the clock radio. She freaked out! I called the desk clerk and told them. As I was telling them about the roaches, I smashed one for them to see. The desk clerk came to our room and I showed the dead roach to her. She said the room was blocked and that we shouldn't been given it. She said the manger would be in tomrrow morning and we could talk to him about the inncident. My wife wanted to leave and go somewhere else, but it was late at night. We was offered another room next door. We moved to that room. My wife was up all night for fear of roaches crawing on her. The next morning I went to talk to the manager, but he didn't come in! The same clerk was there when we checked in the following day and I told him what happened but, he didn't care! I"ll never go there again!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: North Charleston, South Carolina, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Sharon F
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and the price is right. This is the second time we have stayed at this motel in Branson. The continental breakfast was a little disappointing this time. Seems that they ran out of food from the Sunday breakfast but could not get restocked for the Monday breakfast. Having all day Monday we could not figure out why on Tuesday they were still out of some food choices. On Tuesday the regular staff person was on duting and we found out that the part time person did not put in a request. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location (if no traffic!)”
Reviews.Author: buddy1St_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: Melody Lane is right in the middle of the 76 Strip - convenient to everything! Thankfully, there was very little traffic this weekend or else we would not have been able to get to and from the motel parking lot. It was within walking distance to several shops and restaurants so that is good, but if you want to go to Silver Dollar City or the Landing (in downtown Branson), you have to drive and traffic would make that nearly impossible. The upside, however, the rooms were clean (no pillow top bed though), and the staff that we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. We would definitely go back but not at the height of the season, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “For us a great escape to the Ozarks always includes staying at the Branson Melody Lane.”
Reviews.Author: Rocky A
Reviews.Content: We discovered the Branson Melody Lane thanks to our youngest son suggesting we stay there because they had shaded yard swings out front. Immediately we were pleased to be greeted by a very friendly desk manager making our very affordable room reservation easy and expedient. We found the rooms very nice and we were amazed the hotel offered golf cart valet service preventing guest from having to walk up the steep parking lot. The swimming pool was located discretely out of sight of the highway 76 traffic making our swimming experience very relaxing. Starting each morning was wonderful with a Continental breakfast including coffee, juices, cereals, toast and the best part was a hostess making guests fresh hot waffles. Probably the best selling point for the Branson Melody Lane is their location right in the middle of all the Branson magic. Next door is one of the greatest mexican resturants called Poncho Villa and a few steps further is a fantastic trip back in time at the 50s theme ice cream shop called Cakes and Cream. If it is shopping you like then you will love the Branson Melody Lane being right across the street from the Grand Village that features very unique shopping experiences including Kringles Christmas store, Thomas Kinkaid art gallery, wood carvers, tasty seasoning specialist and then you can grab lunch at Mel's Hard Luck Diner where the servers not only bring you incredible old fashioned hamburgers and malts but the servers also sing to you. What is a trip to Branson without the multiple shows to select from? The Branson Melody Lane is walking distance from The Branson Variety Theater, The Baldknobbers, The Presleys, The Haygoods, The Wax Museum and even a voyage aboard the Titanic. The best part about going to these shows and attractions while staying at the Branson Melody Lane is you never have to get in your car and fight the Branson traffic unless you just enjoy that type of stuff. Do we recommend you stay at the Branson Melody Lane on your next visit to Branson, well actually we highly recommend you stay there and you too will discover your magic in the Ozarks at the Branson Melody Lane,

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great price and an edible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tkmayes6
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Branson and our first time at the Melody Lane Inn. It was a great experience, staff were very friendly and helpful with the local attractions. Only complaint was the ice machine was broke in our building so we had to use the one in the other building, just a minot inconvienence.

Reviews.Title: “Basics with a view”
Reviews.Author: jh47201
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have spent several extended weekends at Melody Lane in Branson, MO. We have found the motel to be clean with all the basic necessities. However, what has caught our attention the most has been the view of the Branson hills from the banquet/ breakfast room and deck. It is beautiful. The motel is also located near many attractions, various eateries, and assorted shops. We will be returning to the Branson hills, attractions, and Melody Lane again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and I will be back”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Had a great trip! Everything was within walking distance of hotel. My kids loved the pool. Lee Franks Hotel manager told us to vist the titantic musuem and see Elvis sing at Andy Williams theatre. We did both and had a great time! John Cantrell New York

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. So glad we found it!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Branson many, many times over the last 30 years! Timeshares, cabins, hotels, motels...and this summer we decided to try a place right in the middle of town! We weren't sure if we would like doing that, but it turned out to be one of the best places we have ever stayed. Melody Lane is NOT a brand new hotel, in fact, I believe it is one of the oldest on the strip. It is, however, very clean and neat, which is all that matters to me, my husband, and our 4 teenagers. We stayed in the family room, which consisted of a large living room, kitchen and dining room downstairs (with full washer and dryer), and upstairs were 2 bedrooms with queen beds, and 2 bathrooms, one with a corner shower, and one with a shower/tub combo. It had its own little porch, and we could step down into the little couryard shaded with trees and sit on the swings and watch traffic crawl by! We also walked next door to a wonderful little Mexican restaurant, walked across the street to a really cute little shopping area with an awesome book and puzzle store, and walked other places. We were right next to Baldknobbers and across the street from Presleys, and Landry's seafood, and the wax museum, and putt-putt...Best of all, the staff was very kind and helpful, AND the rates were great. I was hesitant to put a review out here, because I don't want anyone to steal our special little family room when we want it...But that would be kind of selfish, now, wouldn't it?! Hope this little review helps. Thanks for a great time, Melody Lane!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Much”
Reviews.Author: jens1555
Reviews.Content: Hotel was outdated but for the price we got it was just fine, only issue was every ice machine was broken except one. Breakfast was nothing special 3 types of cereal, toast, milk, oatmeal, and a waffle maker to make your own waffles. Like I said if you are just looking for a decent place to stay and nothing more it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Melody Lanes”
Reviews.Author: TTyler_socal
Reviews.Content: Friday Night Checking in Front desk did not know how to run Credit Card. Said it was bad need to pa cash. While taking shower wall had water coming out of it and running under bed. Move to Room next store but only one key with #158 on it but room was 608. Saturday night forgot which room and no room # on key my mom tried to open room 605. On check out while loading car in front of office window where desk could see us loading truck called at 11:15AM and told my mom check out was at 11:00AM. This was not reminder but rude call. I came to Office and told them about the Credit CardCo. said there was attempts to charge CC Friday night. and Bill had no name of Hotel so my Tax Account will flash this bill.. I told about have to move room in the middle of my shower. Also did you see me loading the car in front of your office? She said yes but you were still in the room after 11:00AM. I asked she was rude and a man in other office said he heard enough. And I was in here Saturday Night complaining about the room and start with other comments about Saturday Night. He would not let me talk for over 5 minutes I said hold it twice but he keep going on till I yelled at him to shout up because I did not come to office Saturday Night so why are going on about how rude I was when it was not me and you are talking in laud voice and tried to intimate me is not working. I tried to tell him I own a Electrical Co. in CA for 29 years with my dad and I would never go that far talking to Customers like that. That when I left. I did go back to Branson a week later and stay at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Motel”
Reviews.Author: aznails
Reviews.Content: We paid about $50 per night total for our room here and it was not worth any more than that. The rooms are old and plain, but serve the purpose as a place to sleep and shower. Good, central location. Friendly and helpful staff. However, the hot tub was out of order and the pool was too cold to go in. The ice machine by our room was broken so we had to walk a little further to use a different one. The A/C would wake us up every time it kicked on, so I had to wear earplugs. Also, they ran out of milk for cereal our first morning there. Overall, it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mrbishopfist
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay, just in the heart of Branson. Location was great, breakfast, and Staff. New paint and exteriors has really livened this place up.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Rick302
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. The rooms were comfortable and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jannie1121
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the stay at the Melody Lane Inn. You can't beat the location, friendly staff, or free breakfast. Yes, the rooms are a bit dated, but so are the majority of the rooms in Branson. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotels I've Ever Stayed In!!!”
Reviews.Author: larrys66diner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived shortly before midnight to check into the hotel. Accompanying us was another married couple; both of us were celebrating our wedding anniversaries. The lobby of the hotel upon check-in was very impressive. When we got to our room (519), my wife spotted a live ROACH on the bathroom vanity near the tissue box, and my friend spotted a dead roach near the entryway to the motel room. Even having prior knowledge that two married couples were staying in the room, only two sets of towels and washcloths were provided. The light bulb didn't appeared to be burnt out in the lamp on the table between both Queen-sized beds. My friend and I walked back to the office to get another set of linen, at which time we told the night clerk about the roach situation, but forgot to mention the lamp. She replied she'd leave a voicemail for the manager. When we returned from our outings the following afternoon, we noticed that the beds had been made but once again, there was only two sets of linen! When I attempted to telephone the front desk, it was only then that I discovered the telephone in our room didn't even work!!! My friend and I AGAIN walked up to the lobby to get another set of linen, along with a box of tissues, and a lightbulb for the lamp between the beds. We complained to the night clerk (a different one from the previous night) and she seemed to be sympathetic. She advised us that the non-working telephone was apparently an on-going problem. We told her that we would most certainly not return to this motel after the type of service and accommodations we'd received during our 2-night stay here. The "high-speed" internet is very LOW speed and atrocious. The continental breakfast consisted of only 3 cereals; waffles; and fruit. Although I will admit the waffles tasted fine, there was only ONE waffle iron that worked. I do NOT recommend this motel for anyone; in fact, I would not even consider letting my pet stay in this facility!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: bobtinaalexander
Reviews.Content: the shower tub was filthy the toilet didnt flush outside our room was a stinch of a dead mouse so bad u could not be out . are room was so hot when we got in i turned air on high we swam for a cpl hours room was still really hot went to dinner and show got back @ 10 room was still on the warm side but not like it was when we checked in i didnt see any friendly people working there the desk clerk was on the rude side the lady in the breakfast room was on the rude side . i will never stay here again it was my first and last time

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fourboys4nana
Reviews.Content: I did not mind the concrete block room we stayed in, or how antiquated everything was--which included the old air conditioner and scratched up furniture. What I DID mind was that our room had ROACHES. The sheets were STAINED. When I asked for maid service to come in, they left the SAME SHEETS ON and only made the bed up. They did not throw away the used cup in the coffee pot, nor give us new ones, but DID leave an envelope on the TV for us to give them a tip. Breakfast consisted of 3 kinds of cereal, stale bread, canned fruit; the "hot Belgian waffles" that were advertised was "you make them yourself" and there was only ONE waffle iron available in the entire dining area for everyone in the hotel to use! Plus, at the counter next to the bowl of canned fruit was a jar labelled "tips for gas money"!! The front desk person was not friendly at all. I was given a set of keys and told if I didn't get them back to her by 11:00 a.m. the day I was checking out there would be a $30 charge! BUYER BEWARE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: arcrow
Reviews.Content: We booked this motel because it was reasonably priced and was in a great location. I read reviews on here before booking the room, and it was pretty much what I expected. It's nothing fancy, but for a motel its age it's in decent shape. We had no issues with our room. I accidentally left the Do Not Disturb sign up when out for the day, and the maids left a bag of fresh towels at our door. Was a nice touch and saved me a trip to the office to get towels.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect for a room at this price”
Reviews.Author: mill23
Reviews.Content: We booked this room because of the low price. We figured we would only be in the room to sleep, so why not give it a try? It didn't exceed our expectations, but we weren't disappointed either. The room was clean (except for the sticky bedspread--gross, I know, but it was changed after we asked the maids for a new one), the bed was decently comfortable, and we didn't hear any noise from our neighbors. The rooms are old, but I wasn't expecting anything newly renovated for the price. We didn't use the pool, but it looked clean and inviting. The toilet wasn't working when we first arrived, but it was quickly fixed after we told the staff. The continental breakfast consisted of cereal, toast, waffles, and orange juice. I would recommend this hotel for the great price and good location, but wouldn't recommend it for anyone looking to spend time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The Service is so exceptional that you wouldn't separate them from a 4 or 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DSSEXPLORER
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean. The Guest services reps are very helpful in anyway possible and they make it convenient to want to stay another night.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: SevaLara
Reviews.Content: This motel is right on the frontage road of the main drag (Highway 76) as you drive into Branson. It was ideally located near several of the theaters, shows, restaurants, and shops and you can easily walk to them (we are of the age we don't walk very far any more!) While we normally stay at the nicer 3 and 4 star hotels, because we wanted to spend our money on the shows, we picked this motel for its price. To tell the truth, I was expecting the worst but was pleasantly surprised. While this is an older motel (looks like something you might have stayed at with your parents in the 60s as evidenced by the furnishings) it is very neat and clean and offers the same toiletries as the 4 stars. Also, the front office is on the flat part of the road but once you drive around the office to go to the rooms, they are on a steep, downwards slope . However, you will get used to this as this is true of almost all of the hotels and theaters in Branson. What we liked about the Melody Lane Inn's design was that they placed an entrance way at each level opn the slope so that if you parked near that entranceway, you just walked out onto a flat walkway - no matter what level (1, 2, 3, or 4) your room was on and didn't have to use the stairs. The front desk personnel were friendly and helpful. There is a tour/ticket desk in the lobby with brochures and tickets for everything. AThey also put coupon books in your room so you don't have to search for discounts. As a final point, Melody Lane Inn advertises a continental breakfast included, but what you get is more than the usual definition of "continental." Cereals, toast, coffee, tea, juice, milk, waffles, and fruit. We enjoyed our 3 day stay even if they don't have the latest in mattresses and would definitely stay there again. While you are there, chek out Odee's Restaurant & Barbeque - great steak, chicken, etc. for fantastic prices (they had 5 different specials that were $20 for 2 people, drinks included).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: MAS353
Reviews.Content: Not a brand new hotel, but what do you expect for the money. It was very clean and staff was more than kind and accomodating. Breakfast was a nice plus with homemade waffles!

Reviews.Title: “Better accodomations than expected”
Reviews.Author: Evildeadfan123
Reviews.Content: Me and my Husband, Brian, stayed at Melody Lane Inn from September 4 and checked out September 7th. I had read all the bad reviews from 2 years ago, and noticed that in 2008, it was under new Management. When we arrived, we checked in with no problems. When we entered the room, it was clean, no smells. Checked the bathroom, no drips, was very clean. The only complaint I had was the bed. It wasn't very comfortable, but the room was about $50.00 a night, with a package deal. The pool and spa were clean and clear, no foam in the spa, they were well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: pilotpete83198
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 4:30PM. The hotel was over 1/2 full with over 700 rooms. We were greeted promptly and given room keys and a map of the grounds. The hotel room smelled awesome! We had pristeenly white towels and the shower was immaculate! The a/c was perfect and the beds were comfortable. I would totally reccommend this hotel to anyone! There is also breakfast too, which is modest, but fresh!

Reviews.Title: “warning black mold”
Reviews.Author: Savosouri
Reviews.Content: Not a pleasant stay, the room we rented smelled musty and we found black mold like growth on the panels beside the heat pump/ac unit. Lots of condensation off the windows from the cold left standing water on the AC unit. There was no tissue left in the room after the cleaning. In my brother's room the panels had been repainted and there was no odor. Checkin was laboriously slow. Good continental breakfast reasonable rates. Outrageous pet policy.

Reviews.Title: “new owners dont care”
Reviews.Author: shawnsauto
Reviews.Content: I have BEEN taking my family to Branson for the last 10 years and we always stayed at melody lane if it was available.this year on fall break we checked in at about 10 pm then went to get some food and drive around to see wat was new we got back to the room about 12 and it stunk like glue because of the new carpet witch was understandable but in the bath tub were a bunch of bugs so i turned on the water and washed them down the drain then i turned on the tv and half the screen had a black box covering it on every Channel so we decided to go to sleep but could not because the matresses were like a peice of cardboard on springs and there was a blood stain on one of the sheets so we decided to leave.The girl at the desk said i dont know how to refund your credit card but if you come back tomarrow you will get a full refund.so we checked in to the Regal Hotel,it was great and 20 dollars cheaper and got free buffet for all four of us every morning at dockers resturant one block away.anyway the next day we went to get a refund only to be refused even though we were told otherwise.there are over 100 hotels in Branson,dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for the price!”
Reviews.Author: philipIowa
Reviews.Content: We were glad to see that the room had been newly carpeted. There was a new carpet smell, but they came around later and sprayed something and it was a lot better. The room was in good shape except the ceiling in the bathroom was peeling. Probably could use a new mattress. We had to replace two lightbulbs that were burnt out, had trouble entering the room with the key (going to electronic credit card type keys would eliminate the problem) had maintenance fix it and the door would not shut unless you slammed it, and our phone didn't work. The air conditioner worked well. There was a male housekeeper that was very pleasant and responded to our needs. One of the bedspreads had a big hole in it, the hot tub was too hot and we could not stand to be in it for more than a few minutes. Of all the desk clerks, Jerry was the best, very helpful and responded to our every request and when it was Jerry's time to make the cookies, they were the best! We were surprised the last morning we woke up that there was a hole in the roof due to a fire. You can honestly say it was a room with a view. Luckily everyone was ok. All in all for the price, it was an ok place to stay. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay There Again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisMoxycat
Reviews.Content: The rooms are in dire need of updating and maintenance. Shower faucet fell off in my hand. Also had problems getting the problems fixed. Maintenance "fixed" the faucet, left the room -2 minutes later, it fell apart in my hands again. I took the pieces to the front desk before 9AM. Returned to the room about 2PM and it had not been fixed......still unable to use the shower. 3rd time --they replaced the faucet. The water strip along the bottom of the tub was hanging off on the floor upon our arrival, and stayed there even though maintenance had been in the room several times. The carpet had lots of big stains and a hot iron burn mark. The counter top had worn through spots and part of the bottom of the counter was hanging down. Front desk staff came off as entirely disinterested in me, my concerns, my questions or anything that resembled hospitality. You get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly/Nasty/Dirty Place”
Reviews.Author: Daphne5511
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Melody Lane on a Sunday night. This was our first trip to Branson and we were accompanied by our dog, Daphne. We searched on line for a motel that would take dogs. We checked in, went to our room and were very disappointed. The room smelled of pet urine and also had a very musty smell. There were pet urine stains on the mattress and some sort of feces stain on the bathroom wall. Also there were numerous holes in the bedspread. The air conditioner was not working properly and there was no filter in the unit. It was broken and pieces were missing. The entire room was totally disgusting. We went back to the desk, checked out and went to the Holiday Inn Express, which was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. We would not recommend this motel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent strip style motel/inn”
Reviews.Author: alison_pr
Reviews.Content: We hit Branson in the early evening after two short flights from TX to OK and then a 5 hour drive from OK to MO. Needless to say, we were a tad road weary. Here is my impression of the Inn: 1) It was very easy to find and conveniently located on the strip. As one reviewer already mentioned, within walking distance to shows and restaurants. 2) Staff was very friendly and helpful. (There must have been a change of management or something since the 2007 reviews were posted here.) 3) I was a little dismayed to have to lug my suitcase up the stairs to our room, but this is the style lodging it is, so I dealt with it. 4) I thought there was an odd odor (not strong, though) in the open air stairwell and balcony, but our room didn't smell at all. 5) Our room was basic and a bit worn (maybe it was just a seeming out of date carpet and bedspread designs or maybe it was that we had recently stayed in a nice Hampton Inn) but all was very clean and comfortable. (I will get to how comfortable in a minute.) 6) Room service was daily and kept us well supplied. This staff was also very friendly. 7) Now to the comfortable: Our first night there, after we walked home from a show, I ended up horrible ill - vomiting every 15-20 minutes from 11 p.m. to 7 a.m. I also had a bit of a fever and chills. Needless to say, I got very little sleep. I then spent the next day crawling from the bed to a warm bath as I had no energy and all my body ached. With my stomach so raw and me being dehydrated, I sucked on cupfuls of wonderfully refreshing ice cubes in endless supply from a machine at the foot of the stairs. The following day was spent mostly in bed or sitting in a chair. All that time of being sick, not once did I wish I was home in my own bed or bathroom - I was very comfortable right where I was. (Though I do have to admit that those ice cubes lost their magical elixir like powers the less dehydrated I became, though they still were fine. :-) 8) The following day I slowly made my way down to the dining room and while I was not overly impressed with the variety (again having recently stayed at the HI and my stomach still being in a bit of a finicky mood), it certainly had a basic selection that would do just fine: freshly made waffles, toast, hot and cold cereals, and beverages. (I may have overlooked something.)

Reviews.Title: “Melody Lane Inn-Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CSnook
Reviews.Content: My husband, two kids, and I stayed at the Melody Lane Inn last summer. It was nice, clean, well kept. The pool was clean. We had fresh towels every day. The room was a little run down, but clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. We are going back to Branson this summer and plan to stay at the Melody Lane Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “ooooooo, please don't stop here”
Reviews.Author: IowanativeinKC
Reviews.Content: Thinking any motel on the "strip" would be okay, we called to get a last minute room if available. Please don't go there. We got a handicapped room. It smelled very bad. After airing it out we found out the air conditioner didn't work. They had said they were queen sized beds but were only full sized beds. The carpet was stained so badly with "who knows what". I even photographed it because I didn't want it to be blamed on us. The bathroom molding was torn off the tub area and there was black mold in the corners by the walls near the tub. I didn't want to stay but at the last minute we didn't know if anything else was available. Then, even though the carpet was stained so badly, they would not let us bring the dog in our room even though I offered to pay extra. So, our dog slept in the suv outside our room. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone and should have left when I saw the tattered couch in the "welcoming room" of the motel office. Sorry - we won't go back and we don't recommend. They offered free breakfast and free ice cream in the evenings but if the unclean rooms matched anything in the kitchen, we didn't eat there. Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: carolctexas
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance to shows and resturants. The king suite rooms in the back were quiet and comfortable. Free breakfast and coffee was added bonus. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but totally acceptable”
Reviews.Author: RkyAlberta_Canada
Reviews.Content: This hotel treated us ery well. We arrived in the wee hours of the morning, the desk clerk had our file out waiting for us to arrive. The room was a bit worn, but sheets were clean and clean towels were delivered every day. There was a continental breakfast served every morning, that served our purposes. Coffee seemed to be available whenever you wanted one. In the evening cookies were set out. There was a small pool, that was cleaned regularly. The price was also right.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveleers
Reviews.Content: This was the WORST hotel we have ever stayed at! We had a non-smoking room but as soon as we opened the door it was like walking into a wall of stink! It was like a mixture of smoke and locker room. The room was outdated and DIRTY. The carpet and chairs were stained, it was dusty, 2 of the 4 lamps didn't work. The bathroom was NASTY!!!! Grimy floors and toilet, hair in the bathtub, black moldy stuff around the tub & toilet and a shower curtain that should have been changed a year ago. The "continental breakfast" is NOT! You get cereal, toast with jelly and "not so fresh" fruit. If you're lucky, you can make your own waffle with one of their two waffle machines (get there early, because with 200-300 guests, it may be difficult to get a turn). We tried to rationalize it, thinking "Well, it was less expensive than all the other hotels" online - WRONG!!! When we went along HWY 76 (the entertainment strip on which this hotel is located) we looked at all the hotels (including some very NICE ones) and they all advertised rooms for LESS than we paid. We checked into it and learned that we could have gotten the same room (style and size) at several other NICER hotels for $10-$20 less per night! We will NEVER stay at the Melody Lane Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: am0806
Reviews.Content: This hotel was included in a package deal I purchased. When I got the, the lady at the front desk acted as if she was being inconvienced by checking me into my room. The room was pretty clean, but there was a huge brown spot above the shower where something had apparently been leaking. Also, the vinyl flooring in the bathroom was damaged. The people cleaning the rooms didn't seem "right" to me either, however, they were polite. The window to my room looked like it had been hit by bullets and temporarily repaired. If this is the cheapest place you can find in Branson for your budget, it is tolerable. If you would like to feel safer and more welcome, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “All writers of the good reviews are liars or use to crap”
Reviews.Author: jackiejenkins
Reviews.Content: The Melody Lane Inn was horrible! The front desk clerk "Jen" was rude and nuts..... The pool was filthy, the carpet was stained, the continental breakfast was NOT.....There are two waffle machines for about 300 guest......The toilet was not clean....The staff a husband and wife or girlfriend and boyfriend were outside cursing each other out and he told her to go clock out and when she came back he kissed her? On Saturday one of the owners/manager was on the patio while my family was there and she was looking for James to fire him.... It was a horrible experience..... STAY ELSEWHERE.... EVEN YOUR CAR IS BETTER..... DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.....I AM TRYING TO GET MINE BACK AND I AM CALLING THE BBB Jacqueline Jenkins 3145215359 3142218103

Reviews.Title: “Peice of Crap!!!”
Reviews.Author: wsaffore
Reviews.Content: This place really screwed our entire vaction!!! To begin with the manager of the place had a very nasty attitude, she spoke to her employees like crap, she was very un-welcoming and rude. When we got the keys to our room and opened up, it was filthy, the floors looked as if they were stained for years, the bed comfortor was smelly and torn, their were cumbs and food particles everywhere, not to mention that my two year old pulled out a bag of goldfish from under the bed from the previous guests. The pool was unclean and small. Those pictures that they advertise are a joke. If you want your vaction to be anything near decent, STAY AWAY from this place..... spend a few extra bucks and go anywhere else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Melody Lane”
Reviews.Author: Hobo44
Reviews.Content: We had the "room by the ice and vending machines"...noisy in the mornings since it seemed to be the employee hangout. No remote for the t.v....burned out lightbulbs...rain leaked under the door when it rained...pool extremely small...but if you're on a budget as we were...great place for the $$.

Reviews.Title: “What a Joke!”
Reviews.Author: Flamingo69
Reviews.Content: I called and made reservations with the hotel directly. I was told that we would have 2 queen beds in the front since I was taking my grandmother (85 years old) on a well deserved vacation. Upon my arrival I was told that I had been upgraded to a king suite. An upgrade that was going to put my grandmother on a pullout sofa bed. I told the staff that would not work. I was told that she, the desk clerk, could not do anything about it. I took the key to the room and found that the toilet did not work and our room was very dark. I walked next door and could save $30.00, I went back collected our belongings and checked out. Don't stay here if you want friendly service and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - and a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: cjarkansas
Reviews.Content: We have five rooms booked last weekend at Melody Lane. Since the price we had been given was very low compared to some other motels we've stayed in at Branson, we didn't expect much - just a clean place to sleep. However, the Melody Lane surpassed in comfort, cleanliness, quietness, view, convenience to restaurants, etc., many others we've stayed in for LOTS more money. I think it's the greatest value in Branson. The beds were very, very comfortable. The Melody Lane is old, and some of the drapes are a little washer worn - as were some of the bedspreads...but I actually prefer the worn soft cotton feel to those paper backed stiff ones in the newer hotels. Everything - though maybe a little worn - was spotlessly clean. The staff was so anxious to please and we had contact with two great desk clerks. This motel has SWINGS out front where it's fun to sit and watch the traffic go by. There are many good restaurants in walking distance. Hard Luck Diner is across the street, as is Sadie's. Bald Knobbers is next door - and favorite for everyone with us - the Tex Mex place next door. This motel is as much a part of "old" Branson as the Bald Knobbers, and it just "feels" right and is far superior to many newer lodging choices in what it offers for such a good price. Our only tiny negative was that the kids (grown children) didn't think much of the continental breakfast offerings - but - hey, it was free! AND, they made up for it by offering free cookies and ice cream in the evening!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: sdawg
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel. Non-smoking room was not. Even the towels smelled like smoke. Room was not very clean. Staff not very helpful. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Basic”
Reviews.Author: DebbyLynn
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Melody Lane Inn, we were there for 3 nights over the Thanksgiving weekend. Having never seen the motel in person (we booked over the internet) we were pleasantly surprised at how conveniently located we were to many major attractions and restaurants on Hwy 76. Our room was basic but clean. The only complaint about the room was that the sheets on one bed were torn when we checked in and were not replaced during our stay. We had hoped to enjoy the complimentary breakfast but due to the huge number of guests, we couldn't get in the door of the dining area. We ended up next door at the Baldknobber Restaurant and totally enjoyed their breakfast buffet all 3 mornings (at $3.99 a real bargain!). The next time we go to Branson, we're going to stay at the Baldknobber Motel, mostly due to their breakfast buffet and because they share the same great location on Hwy 76 as Melody Lane Inn (and their rates are a bit less).

Reviews.Title: “Super honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: toolcats1
Reviews.Content: We stayed fron Sept 11 to Sept 13. It is right on the strip and close to many attractions and shops. Our room was not fancy but it was VERY clean and comfortable. There are 3 buildings around a very steep driveway. I have a bad knee so we usually drove up the hill to the breakfaste area and to the pool rather than walking. We stayed in the building at the back of the property in a non-smoking room. There was no smoke smell in the room. The airconditioner was a wall unit but worked well and was quieter than this type usually is. This was the first hotel I have ever stayed in that I did not have to use earplugs to be able to sleep. We brought our own air mattress because we can't sleep on the normal hard beds in hotels, but the bed in our room was VERY comfortable and we did not need to use our air mattress. There was a small couch that folded out into a bed and a comfortable chair and foot rest. The front desk staff were very helpful. We decided to stay an extra day and they helped us stay in our old room and gave us a good rate-then we changed our minds and they were very nice and understanding in canceling the extra day. There is a place right in the lobby to purchase show tickets-with or without the usual time share speel-no pressure if you don't want to listen to the time share talk for cheaper tickets. The price of the regular tickets was the same as anywhere else and they booked them so we never stood in line anywhere. Because it was not prime time in the summer it was not crowded. The ladies in the breakfaste room worked really hard at keeping things filled and CLEAN!! Fruit, cereal, bagles, toast, waffles, juices, milk and coffee were the breakfaste offerings. (There is a nice buffet at Baldnobbers next door if you want something else for breakfaste without having to drive.) We even got up late one morning and there was still plenty at 9am. Most other places we have stayed are all out of free breakfaste by 7 or 8.The outdoor deck out side of the breakfaste room was a relaxing place to plan our day as we ate. The inside breakfaste room had a tv turned to the news but turned low so you could listen or not without being annoyed. The outdoor pool was very clean but cold--there was a matience person fixing the heater and we did not have time to go later in our stay.. The small hot tub was very warm and pleasent. In the evening there are free home baked cookies and ice cream in the lobby. There are even several porch swings out front under some nice trees if you want to sit and watch the cars and people go by. If we go back to Branson we will stay at Melody Lane Inn. Hint--If you call the hotel directly at the last minute they sometimes have special rates in the middle of the week. We payed full price by booking months in advance through Expedia and got then got there and they had a special for less than half. BUT- we feel like it was a bargin even at full price!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but clean up your pool water.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a nice neat little hotel w/ friendly staff--very helpful and kind. We found the breakfast to be sufficient for our needs. The rooms are tidy and the shower is great. The main negative I had about this hotel is the pool. Families want a nice pool area to go to with well kept deck and extra towels and a clean pool, but Melody Lane lacks the main thing we look for in a hotel. They should do their pool maintenance daily if they are not currently doing so, or if they are they need to educate their maintenance man on how to get clean pool water. The water was in terrible condition-- very dirty and too much clhlorine. They probably should clean the filter more often or get a better one. Other than that our family had a great time at this hotel-- I wish I could have rated them better. So, here's a hint to the management. "Take a sample of your pool water to the nearest pool store and they will tell you what you need to do AND DO IT." You'll get happier Families. And the staff and management was so friendly that I bet they will do it too. So consider Melody Lane for your Branson vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda1957870
Reviews.Content: Melody Lane is the only place I stay in Branson. Have stayed there 2-3 times a year for many, many years. No, it's not fancy but it's in a great location, right beside my favorite music show, The BALDKNOBBERS. Also, Hazel, in the continental breakfast room is wonderful. We love visiting with her every time we stay there. She's like our old time friend. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are clean. Lots of nice shops, restaurants, go-karts, etc. to walk to. LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: “Basic cheap hotel with good location 12/17/05 - 12/19/05”
Reviews.Author: Cruise,J.D.
Reviews.Content: I had already reserved and paid for a hotel room at the Melody Lane Inn on Hotwire. We arrived around 7:30 and hit “the strip”. We found our hotel, the Melody Lane Inn, and checked-in. I was pleased with the location; it is right on the strip and close to tons of restaurants, shops, and shows. My wife forgot her hair dryer but the clerk was able to give us one for our stay free of charge. The hotel room was basic, but clean. The shower had ample hot water and very good water pressure. The bed was a little stiff for my taste. There was sufficient food and variety for us at the continental breakfast. Our room was $38/night, but I saw several other budget-type hotels advertising $28/night. I couldn’t comment on their value, but I was satisfied with the Melody Lane Inn and would recommend it for someone looking for a clean budget hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Melody Lane Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, We have just returned from staying for the weekend of Labor Day at the Melody Lane Inn, it was a very nice stay , the room was comfortble, 2 queen size beds, continental breakfast was so convenient and plentiful, the front desk people were very accomadating, friendly, room service was excellent , it was located right on the strip in Branson, close to everything, we would not hesitate to recommend or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Melody Lane Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have taken a motorcoach group to this motel every year for the past three years and plan to do so again this year. The rooms are always clean; the staff is always pleasant and eager to accommodate whatever our seniors need. The Inn is an easy walk to several specialty shops, theaters and restaurants. t I would recommend the Melody Lane Inn to anyone or any group. Thank you, Melody Lane Inn, for being our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Melody Lane Inn is just so/so...so if you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: angie2693
Reviews.Content: The Melody Lane Inn is just so/so...so if you are looking for nicer accomodations or helpful staff stay somewhere else. We had asked for four ground floor rooms as we were traveling with two people who were not able the walk very far. We were given rooms on the second teir far away from any reasonable parking. Cribs were an extra $5 a night and were very rickety with marginal bedding. Stayed two nights but will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on Melody Lane Inn, I was a little anxious of what I might find since we had never been to Branson. WHAT A PLEASANT SURPRISE! The motel is centrally located and very well kept. Everything was in working order and CLEAN. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had never seen a motel with such a steep parking lot (many of the motels in Branson are like this) and Melody Lane Inn even had a large golf cart driven by their employees to take you up and down the hill. The breakfast room was clean and guests never ran out of anything. We will recommend Melody Lane Inn to all of our friends going to Branson!

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place! Go to the Showboat! Stay at the Grand Victorian”
Reviews.Author: xine1123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great trip to Branson. We started out staying at the Melody Lane Inn, which is about as basic as you can get, (almost drab) but was clean. It was a warm week, and we were very disappointed that the pool wasn't open, even just to sit around, nor was the hot tub. Both were empty. We checked out after one night and moved to the Grand Victorian down the street, which is a beautiful hotel. The staff there could not have been nicer, the rooms are great, and they have a wonderful complimentary breakfast each morning. Our rooms overlooked the Ozarks and were so comfortable. We all had a balcony. It's very reasonable, also. We saw 4 shows and the best of all was the Branson Belle Showboat. It was wonderful and worth every penny! The talking dog act is hysterical, and the Russian dancers were fabulous. See it if you can. We also saw Stuck in the 70's, Lost in the 50's, and the Legends show. They were all good. Wish we had time for more.

HotelInfo.Name: Melody Lane Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2821 West Highway 76, Branson, MO 65615
